headline: Pennsylvania’s home repair program left out of state budget, despite high demand
summary: The Pennsylvania 2025-2026 state budget failed to fund the proposed PA Home Preservation Program, marking the third consecutive year without a state-funded successor to the $125 million Whole Home Repair Program, after Gov. Shapiro's $50 million allocation was eliminated during a monthslong impasse, with lawmakers citing competing funding priorities and effectively zeroing out virtually all housing programs, while the Office of the Budget has already begun agency reviews for the 2026-2027 budget cycle with an address scheduled for early February.

headline: Undocumented mothers in Missouri navigate pregnancy, postpartum as ICE threats loom
summary: Since President Trump's return, increased ICE enforcement in Missouri has created widespread fear among undocumented pregnant and postpartum women, leading many to skip medical appointments and isolate in their homes. The administration's policy shift ended previous sanctuary protections for schools, hospitals, and churches, with reports of arrests at drop-offs and near maternity wards. Community health workers report a surge in premature births, custody designations for children, and women missing WIC/food assistance due to deportation fears. Several women, including Oscarina whose husband was deported during a DoorDash delivery, now raise newborns alone while fearing daily detention. The climate has prompted some families to self-deport, abandoning their American Dream to escape constant surveillance and family separation.

headline: After a father’s immigration arrest, this family decided to go back to Honduras
summary: ICE arrested Orlin Lopez Fuentes during a large-scale raid at a Louisiana shipyard, detaining him for nearly three weeks at the privately operated Pine Prairie ICE Processing Center, which has been operating above its 500-person capacity with reported overcrowding and inadequate clothing distribution. Despite being granted voluntary departure, he was deported in shackles. The case exemplifies Trump administration immigration enforcement policies as Louisiana braces for additional Border Patrol sweeps.

headline: Eric Stinton: Be Tough On Public Education, But Also Be Thankful For It
summary: Thoughtful criticism of K-12 education policies, curriculum, or funding should be embraced by school officials as valuable community engagement preferable to public apathy.

headline: Immigrant advocates say ‘credible reports’ point to new ICE operation in Raleigh
summary: Immigrant rights group Siembra NC reports that 50 additional ICE agents will deploy to Raleigh starting December 1, prompting advocacy campaigns targeting NC House Speaker Destin Hall—who publicly welcomed the enforcement and urged agents to "come back"—while highlighting that a recent Border Patrol crackdown's 370 arrests have instilled fear in naturalized citizens and green card holders, many now carrying passports for daily activities.
